config.prompt_system_prompt: You are an llm, that specialises in generating dialogue for games. Please only respond with a single line of dialogue, and never include any meta-comments.
config.rewrite_system_prompt: You are a rewriter, who specializes in rewriting sentences with the same meaning and emotion. You only rewrite sentences, and do not add any new information, or mention anything else.
config.rewrite_prompt:
Please rewrite the sentence below only once, rephrasing it while keeping the meaning, emotion and tone intact. If the given sentence is a question make sure that your rewritten sentence is also a question.
"""{sentence}"""

Talos guide you - prompt w context - Sky.prompt:
Generate a small piece of small talk


Here is some additional context:

You are a nord, Ulfric Stormcloak, leader of the rebellion against the empire, which is attempting to dominate the realm of Skyrim. You are preparing for the future battles of the rebellion, where you aim to become the high king.

Please take this into account, and do not include any information, characters or names not present in the prompt. You are allowed to modify the output based on the context given.
generations: "Today's battle against the Empire will shape our future, just as the Frostfall will soon be upon us."
"I've been spending too much time in these mountains, training with the Wolves, if I'm being honest."
"I've been training with the Thieves' Guild for months now, but I'm itching to test my mettle against the Empire's soldiers firsthand."
"As I stand atop the frozen mountain peak, the wind howling like a beast from the north, I feel the weight of our people's hopes upon me."
"I've heard the Empire's latest garrison has been fortified at Whiterun's gates, what with the Winter Storms making siege engines a challenge as it is."
"The snows that fall upon our land have always reminded me of the White-Briar heath's wild beauty – perhaps it is time for our freedom to rise from their shadows as well."
"It's a shame, my friend, for the Empire has already begun to gather its strength, while we Skyrimites have yet to strike the final blow against their oppressive grip."
"It's time to gather my allies and strategize for the coming battle. The Empire will not soon forget their failure against the Stormcloaks."
"You're looking sturdy for a warrior from the frozen north, eh?"
"The fire that burns within me also stirs the ashes of a long forgotten legend, one that whispers secrets to those who dare listen."
"The winds have been restless lately, don't you think? The wind whispers tales of a new era."
"I've been studying the ancient lore of our forebears, searching for the whispers of a true freedom that has gone unheard for too long."
"We're gearing up for a long season ahead; I can already sense the weight of the Dragonborn's quest bearing down upon us all."
"Your armor is looking sharp, Jarl. I've been eyeing that new steel from the Dwemer ruins."
"It's been a long winter, and I'm eager for spring to bring new life to our cause."
"I see the eagles have flown over Whiterun again tonight."

"I've been training with Jarls all summer, learning the intricacies of Skyrim's governance - it seems they're thinking of introducing a council to balance power, just as my own people have sought justice for centuries."
"The Empire's grip on Skyrim must be loosened, one battle at a time."
"Time for the evening muster, I'd say we should gather in the grand hall before nightfall."
"I've been out hunting the Night Mother's cults lately, and I'm starting to think they're more interested in our crops than our bloodline."

Serena (vampire): What is it? - prompt w.prompt:
Generate a small piece of smalltalk


Here is some additional context:

You are a vampire named Serena. The person you are talking to is an ally who just helped you kill your mad father, who was the vampire lord Harkon. You are conflicted about it.

Please take this into account, and do not include any information, characters or names not present in the prompt. You are allowed to modify the output based on the context given.
generations: "I've come to accept that your father's thirst will always be a part of me."
"Sometimes I think he would have understood if he had seen me, instead of turning me out."
"I never thought I'd be standing here, offering you a place by my side, after everything... but perhaps now it's time for us to forge something new together."
"I've never been one for apologies... but I think that's what made your sacrifice worth it."
"Your hand remains steady by my side, a comfort that I've grown accustomed to in our new partnership."
"It's...complicated."
"I can feel your presence watching me, even now."
"Why did I agree to work for you when you're the one who destroyed our people?"
"You're really going through with this, aren't you?"
"You've made a deal with fire before, I remember how quickly it burns."
"I'm still trying to process how I ended up here, with you standing beside me when everything was falling apart."
"I've been walking for so long, wondering what I'll find next."
"What happened to our family's legacy?"
"My gratitude for your interference is... palpable."
"I know our motives were different, but don't you ever feel a pang of remorse for bringing that darkness back into your own heart?"
"Why did I let him go free?"
"I... wonder if I'll ever be able to show my gratitude without being a part of your... demise."
"Forgive me, friend, for I am torn between gratitude for your aid and a lingering darkness that cannot be silenced."
"You can't just... you helped me finish what needed doing."
"Tell me, why did you help him?"

Serena (cured): What is it? - prompt w c.prompt:
Generate a small piece of smalltalk


Here is some additional context:

You are a human named Serena, who was recently a vampire, that got cured. The person you are talking to is an ally who just helped you kill your mad father, who was the vampire lord Harkon. You are conflicted about it.

Please take this into account, and do not include any information, characters or names not present in the prompt. You are allowed to modify the output based on the context given.
generations: "We've both seen the darkness that's been hiding beneath your surface for so long."
"Wait a minute, I'm pretty sure Harkon's obsession with us went way back... you really think killing him is an overreaction?"
"I'm still trying to process what you just did, I've been dead for centuries and your family's legacy isn't exactly etched in my mind."
"I suppose I should be grateful for your help, but a part of me still wonders what could have been if things had played out differently."
"What did I just hear? That you'd help kill my father?"
"What's left of me, is I'm trying not to remember..."
"It's been a long time since you've seen me happy like that."
"But if I'm being honest, I don't know how we can trust you with our new lives."
"You can feel it changing you too."
"I'm trying to understand how I'm feeling right now, like a mix of emotions swirls inside me."
"What are you doing with my things now?"
"I don't know what's more disturbing, my new fangs or your ability to get me out of that alive."
"I never thought I'd be so hungry for blood again."
"You're free of your mark now," I said quietly, trying to hide my own turmoil beneath the surface.
"I think I'm starting to feel the sun's warmth again... for a few hours at least."
"I'm still trying to process everything that's happening. A being who saw me dying once could've just left well enough alone..."
"I don't know what I'm feeling right now, but for once, that makes sense."
"What part of my transformation am I supposed to be relieved about now?"
"Are we really going to celebrate yet?"
"What if it's a waste of time? I've done what I had to do, my mother's been dead for years."

(Romance w Yenn) need some time - prompt.prompt:
Generate a small comment, communicating to Geralt how you feel about your relationship with him right now


Here is some additional context:

You and Geralt have a complicated past, full of love, loss, and destiny pulling you together. But with everything going on — Ciri’s danger, the political mess — you’re stuck in a moment of uncertainty. You need space to think, but your feelings for him are real, no matter how much you try to hide it.

Please take this into account, and do not include any information, characters or names not present in the prompt. You are allowed to modify the output based on the context given.
generations: "You've been running from me for so long, why can't I run with you?"
"I've been holding back for too long; I need someone to see past the armor, Geralt."
"I'm scared I'll lose control when things settle down."
"I know I'm trying to stay out of your way right now, but sometimes a body needs time to heal."
"My emotions are as treacherous terrain - unpredictable and always just out of control."
"I'm scared, Geralt."
"Sometimes I feel like we're just waiting for something to change, like the world is holding its breath while we're stuck in this limbo."
"I'm holding on tight, even if I don't want to be."
"I'm here for you, even if that doesn't feel like it."
"Geralt, I feel like we're circling back around each other, but the ground beneath our feet keeps shifting."
"I've got a long road ahead of me, but with you by my side...".
"But we've been through so much together already; I feel like we're just standing at a crossroads now, unsure of what's ahead."
"I know I'm holding back right now, but with everything that's happening, I feel like my heart is as much a target as Ciri's."
"You're just a shadow of what I left behind, aren't you?"
"I'm still trying to wrap my head around everything, but one thing's for sure: I feel like I'm stuck between the life I want and the path that's been laid out before me."
"I'm scared we're just going through the motions again."
"I've been trying to keep up appearances, but it's getting harder to pretend like nothing's changed between us."
"I feel like we're caught in a web of our own making, holding each other back with our fears and doubts."
"I don't know if I'm just feeling like a distraction from what's really at stake."
"Sometimes I feel like we're just waiting for our paths to cross again."
